items.name: Andreu's .45 automag
items.description: A heavy pistol formerly owned by Andreu; later in Quincy's possession during a ravager attack.

sources.quote: He reached into the knotted rags... withdrew Andreu's .45. He pushed it to her.
This was his automag. He had won it in a game of dice.
Demmy took the .45 and scrambled to keep watch.

items.name: shotgun
items.description: Pump action shotgun that Demmy and Quincy took from the jackal and later used to kill the ravagers.

sources.quote: Demmy wrestled an older man in rags, both hands locked on a shotgun. Each tugged like their lives depended on it.
Demmy nodded, an amused smile touching his lips as he picked up the shotgun.
Demmy growled and lifted the shotgun to his shoulder. He pulled the trigger.

items.name: rusty shiv
aliases: jagged metal shard with cloth-wrapped handle
items.description: Improvised blade carried by the unnamed skerv youth.

sources.quote: He silently drew a rusty shiv from his waistband—a jagged metal shard with a cloth-wrapped handle.

items.name: canvas pack
items.description: A canvas backpack belonging to Gavin, left near Quincy after the attack.

sources.quote: Gavin was gone though his pack remained.

items.name: chip reader
items.description: Desk unit used to charge and debit holocred chips during trades.

sources.quote: Stan... with the chip reader that wirelessly charged or debited chips held over it.

items.name: holocred chips
items.description: Currency chips used for payments and pricing (e.g., holos per liter of water).

sources.quote: Three holos per liter!

items.name: vendor tables
items.description: Tables used by the Three Shovels Caravan to sell goods.

sources.quote: Like one of any number of skervs she bought trinkets from at a sale day vendor table.
Run where, Quincy? Into the wildlands to be a skerv? You just worked the vendor tables. Wanna be one of them?
He was the only person she knew who seemed to like working the vendor tables

items.name: .30 caliber machine gun
items.description: Belt-fed machine guns deployed on scissor-lift mounts from caravan trucks.

sources.quote: Four machine guns, atop rusty scissor-lifts, rose like skeletal claws from the backs of four heavy trucks.

items.name: water trailer
items.description: Towed trailer used by the caravan to sell water by the liter.

sources.quote: They parked the caravan on a hill and put the water trailer at the end of the line.

items.name: wildebeest
items.description: Towed trailer used by the caravan to haul livestock.

sources.quote: We're shooting Even-Odds in the Wildebeest tonight. No livestock, floorboards are scrubbed.
No matter how hard they scrubbed, the wooden floor of the Wildebeest still held the scent of a barnyard.
Go to the Wildebeest. The boys are there playing Even-Odds — play with them.
Gavin's folding chair slammed into the sideboards of The Wildebeest.

items.name: the-gooch
items.description: Truck in the Three Shovels caravan.

sources.quote: Not long after, Quincy lay under Gooch, the loose clutch already confirmed with a quick wiggle. Selecting the tools she needed, she worked in silence.

items.name: purification filters
items.description: Replacement water filters sold by the caravan.

sources.quote: Filters are almost new and will last several months.
Ammo, water, food, medkit, a couple of 100-liter water filters, a thin multi-tool...

items.name: OPEN flag
items.description: Green 'OPEN' flag used by the caravan to start the trading day.

sources.quote: Davian... raised the bright green OPEN flag.

items.name: Puro
items.description: Three Shovels’ home-brew beverage.

sources.quote: We're shooting Even-Odds in the Wildebeest tonight... Three Shovels' home-brew was called Puro.

items.name: Quincy's toolbox
items.description: Personal toolbox belonging to Quincy; retrieved from a barn loft.
capabilities: contains tools for machine repair (implied by request to use it)

sources.quote: She tugged the toolbox down from the loft.
'That's my fucking toolbox,' she muttered.
Let's grab Quincy's toolbox and see if she can get that machine up and running.

items.name: Quincy's pack
items.description: Backpack carried by Quincy, packed with supplies for travel.

sources.quote: Ammo, water, food, medkit, a couple of 100-liter water filters, a thin multi-tool...

items.name: Medkit
items.description: Vehicle-stocked medical kit used to treat Chase.

sources.quote: Ammo, water, food, medkit, a couple of 100-liter water filters...
Fox River hadn’t messed around when they loaded this vehicle—med supplies… stuffed in the back.

items.name: two-seater buggy
items.description: Small two-seat vehicle used by Quincy and Demmy to leave the ravager camp; steering linkage and one motor phase coil were damaged and patched.
items.condition: repaired with patched steering linkage; one phase coil broken

sources.quote: The two-seater jostled along the track... a two-seater cart that gave the impression of flight over the red-dirt plains.
They had two problems: a disconnected steering linkage... and an open circuit on the phases of the motor driving the rear left wheel.
We hook the second-best battery to the solar cell on the roof...

items.name: light-amplification loop
items.description: Head-mounted low-light optical aid used by Quincy; includes a backup, less powerful set shaped like glasses.

sources.quote: Quincy flicked the toggle and the light-amplification loop slid into place.
She had a backup, albeit a less powerful one – more like glasses with one lens.

items.name: rigid solar panel (1m x 1m)
items.description: Rigid one-meter square solar panel strapped to the two-seater’s roof to charge a battery via the distribution node.

sources.quote: A rigid solar panel – one meter by one meter – was strapped to the top of the cart... wired into the electronic distribution node.

items.name: solar charger
items.description: Portable charger used by Quincy and Demmy to charge a battery from the solar panel.

sources.quote: They hooked the solar charger to the battery and connected the distribution node to the cart.

items.name: solar charging mat
items.description: Flexible solar mat originally with the ravager six-seater; used to trickle charge batteries.

sources.quote: A solar charging mat— once used to trickle charge batteries — was draped over the back seats as a sun shade.

items.name: datapad
items.description: Handheld device used by Quincy for mapping and reading.

sources.quote: He pressed the datapad against his knees and read.

items.name: battery (spare)
items.description: Battery salvaged and used with the two-seater and solar charger.

sources.quote: We hook the second-best battery to the solar cell on the roof...
They hooked the solar charger to the battery and connected the distribution node to the cart.

items.name: ravager six-seater
items.description: Abandoned six-seat vehicle slathered with crude armor; riddled with bullet holes; control nexus shredded.

sources.quote: The ravager six-seater was slathered with crude armor... three tight bullet holes... the control nexus was shredded.
They'd scoured it for spare parts and the odd scrap— a battery charger... a solar charging mat...

items.name: Sykotiq
items.description: A drug that 'plagues the wildlands'; referenced as being made in a dirty bathtub.

sources.quote: one of the cooks who made the Sykotiq that plagues the wildlands

items.name: Steinway Piano
items.description: A concert grand piano in a miniature concert hall.

sources.quote: The enormous Steinway loomed behind it, wrapped in shadow — massive.

items.name: Evelyn's handheld device
items.description: A handheld device used by Evelyn.

sources.quote: “...I picked up a new handheld, and... I need you. Meet me at Coriander & Chrome? It's just off the square...”

items.name: Demmy's datapad
items.description: A beaten-up old datapad that Evelyn took from Demmy.

sources.quote: She looked down at the beaten-up old datapad she had taken from Demmy

items.name: Hammond's datapad (terminal 67)
items.description: A remote terminal/datapad assigned to Hammond (terminal 67).

sources.quote: “Number sixty-seven.” Elmer said.
“...that belongs to Hammond.”
“Anyway, we should just remote brick it,” Simon said.

items.name: Communicator (handheld)
items.description: Small handheld device capable of messaging and location tracking.

sources.quote: He spotted the little communicator she had given him.
User Evelyn enabled Location tracking.
bobbing his head to the music coming from his handheld communicator.

items.name: Flaming sword pendant
items.description: Golden pendant depicting a flaming sword, given to Demmy by Brother Olafsen.

sources.quote: "I want you to wear this," he said, pulling the golden pendant with the flaming sword from around his neck.
"I want you to wear this," he said, pulling the golden pendant with the flaming sword from around his neck.

items.name: Broken scissor blade
items.description: Single forearm-length blade from a large pair of scissors, repurposed by Demmy as a weapon.

sources.quote: He recognized the pair of scissors with the broken blade they had stumbled across last night.
Now... it had become something completely different. A weapon.
Demmy began plunging the scissors into the side of the man's neck...shhhck...shhhck...shhhck.

items.name: Podlev
items.description: Small passenger pod using magnetic levitation; pods can chain and separate along routes.

sources.quote: The magnetic levitation system hummed beneath her feet when she stepped aboard.
Her pod joined a chain of other pods gliding through the cityscape.

items.name: Autopacker
items.description: Large machine in the warehouse producing error codes; requires manuals to diagnose.

sources.quote: She scanned through the error codes on the autopacker's display, trying to figure out what it all meant.
Quincy and Lesha were standing around the autopacker.

items.name: AR glasses
items.description: Headset used to access manuals and a file server via scripts; heavy, owlish form factor.

sources.quote: Maybe Lenya has a pair of AR glasses lying around she can let you use.
Quincy had the boxy AR glasses on that Lesha had shown her how to use.

items.name: Sykotiq injector
items.description: Injector used to dose Sykotiq or similar stimulants; Lesha self-administers during withdrawals.

sources.quote: Before Quincy could notice, the Sykotiq injector was already in her hand.

items.name: Handheld radio
items.description: Portable radio used for summoning guards and communicating within the holdfast.

sources.quote: In a fury, she snatched the radio off her gun belt with her other hand and held it to her mouth.
Send guards to the warehouse, about a half dozen, she said into the radio.

items.name: Pistol
items.description: Handgun carried on a belt holster; used to threaten Quincy, Chase, and Lesha.

sources.quote: The ever-present gun belt was around her waist. The holster was empty. The gun was in her hand... it was leveled at them.

items.name: Personal handheld device
items.description: Portable device used to view and present screenshots of messages.

sources.quote: He then set down the handheld device.
He turned on his handheld device, presenting her with the screenshots he had taken.

items.name: Letter opener
items.description: Small blade taken by Demmy to use as improvised shivs.
capabilities: used alongside scissors in lethal attacks

sources.quote: He picked up three shiny letter openers and slipped them into his pocket. A couple more shivs couldn't hurt.
He picked up three shiny letter openers and slipped them into his pocket.
each handle bearing the familiar emblem of the Order — a cross-shaped sword with two flaming snakes
His weapons? A broken pair of cloth scissors and a handful of letter openers.
His weapons? A broken pair of cloth scissors and a handful of letter openers.

description: Small blade taken by Demmy to use as improvised shivs; handles bear the emblem of the Order.
Small desk blade used as an improvised weapon.

items.name: PID device
items.description: Personal device used by Metrofederacy citizens for case work and submissions.
capabilities: show dispatch paths and transport confirmations

sources.quote: On her PID, the appeal docket was already loaded.
A message. From: Lucas::K_291874200 — Subject: Lunch?
TRANSPORT CONFIRMATION – FLIGHT PLATFORM 7C flashed in her PID.

name: PID
description: Personal interface device used for messages, overlays, and alerts.

items.name: Yellow access card
items.description: Yellow card used with a glowing pad to unlock a massive metal door in the lower levels.

sources.quote: He placed the yellow card on the pad. The light turned a vibrant green followed by a satisfying click as the door unlocked.

items.name: Red access card
items.description: Red plastic rectangle worn on a chest clip; tried on the door pad but failed.

sources.quote: a red plastic rectangle clipped to the man's chest. Demmy removed and examined it.
He tried the red card, the light flashing red then yellow again. Still sealed.

items.name: Spiked war club
items.description: Killing club with a diamond-shaped metal head and eight flat metal protrusions parallel to the handle.

sources.quote: a club made for killing... diamond-shaped metal head with eight flat metal protrusions... like axe heads

items.name: Broken cloth scissors
items.description: Improvised, broken cloth scissors used as a lethal weapon.

sources.quote: In a span of five minutes, he'd killed ten people... His weapons? A broken pair of cloth scissors and a handful of letter openers.
His weapons? A broken pair of cloth scissors and a handful of letter openers.

items.name: TEG-6
items.description: Vehicle created by Fox River used by the group to flee Calum-Tam and set course afterward.
capabilities: configured with weapons and medical supplies for missions

sources.quote: Start Demmy practicing in a TEG-6 today. Stock it with everything he might need — weapons, medical supplies, the works.
Quincy punched keys, entering their destination into the nav computer, and the TEG-6 rolled out.
She turned the last TEG-6 in existence around and punched in the coordinates.

items.name: TEG-vehicle
items.description: Vehicle created by Fox River used by the TRG.
capabilities: configured with weapons and medical supplies for missions

sources.quote: Start Demmy practicing in a TEG-6 today. Stock it with everything he might need — weapons, medical supplies, the works.
The TEG-2 roared across the grasslands, its cleated tires tearing into the terrain like claws.
It was dusty and warm outside, but inside the environmentally controlled cab of the TEG-4, it was cool and comfortable.
Quincy punched keys, entering their destination into the nav computer, and the TEG-6 rolled out.
She turned the last TEG-6 in existence around and punched in the coordinates.

items.name: Chemically resistant bag
items.description: Bag resistant to chemical corrosion; used with lye to hide remains.

sources.quote: Councilman Bivualier's remains... Stuffed into a lye-filled, chemically resistant bag and shoved behind a wall panel.
Stuffed into a lye-filled, chemically resistant bag and shoved behind a wall panel.

items.name: Stiletto (30 cm blade)
items.description: A stiletto with a 30 cm blade, brass grip, and finger guard; replacement for Demmy's broken scissors.

sources.quote: The result was a stiletto with a 30-centimeter blade, the hilt replaced with a brass grip and finger guard.

items.name: Small blades (set of six)
items.description: Six smaller blades, similar to letter openers but more durable; carried on Demmy's chest.

sources.quote: Six smaller blades, similar but more durable than the letter openers, went into pockets on his chest.

items.name: 10mm semiauto pistol
items.description: A 10mm semiautomatic pistol.

sources.quote: He picked up the 10mm semiauto. Four extra magazines, each holding eight rounds.
"Let me go. Hand me the pistol," he whispered. Demmy glanced at Quincy, and she nodded.
Quincy took the driver's seat... Lesha sat in the second row, having selected a rifle and a box of cartridges from the back.

items.name: Six-seater vehicle
items.description: A fully-stocked six-seat vehicle used by Demmy for the rescue at Calum-Tam.

sources.quote: He opened the fully-stocked six-seater's tailgate... The six-seater was crammed with supplies, equipment, ammunition...
I've got a six-seater a little distance out. Parked as close as I could... We need to move.

items.name: Night vision goggles
items.description: Head-mounted goggles used to see in low light.

sources.quote: Quincy saw Demmy lift the night vision goggles onto his forehead as they dragged Chase along the gravel path.

items.name: Calum-Tam gate key
items.description: A key taken from a guard to open a small gate in the holdfast wall.

sources.quote: Little gate...in the wall. Killed the guard...took his key.

items.name: Lesha’s long black combat knife
items.description: A long, black combat knife carried by Lesha.

sources.quote: Lesha emerged... She held a long, black combat knife, her gaze fixed on Lenya.

items.name: Stimulant vials
items.description: Vials of stimulants kept in a hut near the warehouse; used to manage Lesha’s dependence.

sources.quote: "In there, top shelf, there's a couple of vials," Lenya wheezed, pointing at the little hut beside the warehouse.

items.name: Submachine gun
items.description: A submachine gun carried by Gavin during the confrontation outside Calum-Tam.

sources.quote: He was much thinner... but it was Gavin. He was grinning. He had a submachine gun.

items.name: Demmy's communicator (given to Demmy by Evelyn)
items.description: Personal communicator originally belonging to Evelyn, given to Demmy.

sources.quote: He opened the first message… Three unread messages on Evelyn’s communicator.
He placed Evelyn’s communicator on cracked soil and covered it with dust and leaves.

items.name: Improvised wooden cross
items.description: A small cross Demmy made from two dry sticks to mark the communicator.

sources.quote: He gathered two dry sticks, fashioning them into a small, crooked cross.

items.name: Antibiotics (injectable vial)
items.description: Antibiotics administered to Chase during field care.

sources.quote: Lesha injected Chase with antibiotics and painkillers before straightening the bone.

items.name: Painkillers (injectable vial)
items.description: Painkillers administered to Chase during field care.

sources.quote: Lesha injected Chase with antibiotics and painkillers before straightening the bone.

items.name: Quadrafan
items.description: Gimbaled-fan flier used for aerial travel and reporting.

sources.quote: The quadrafan's window framed a macabre tapestry: Fox River...
Outside the window, a quadrafan idled on the tarmac… a small boarding ramp extended from its belly.
Within ten minutes, they were aboard the quadrafan and airborne.

items.name: Ultrasonic combat knife
items.description: Knife described as humming with ultrasonic power.

sources.quote: Each clutched a wicked-looking combat knife, humming with ultrasonic power—weapons designed to bypass their opponent's defenses.

items.name: Ceramicrete crate
items.description: Heavily built crate with human-shaped depression and control panel.
capabilities: emits cold gas to fool thermal sensors
sealed enclosure for transport or concealment

sources.quote: It'll be cold for a second, but don't worry, it's just to fool the thermal sensors.

items.name: Ident chip
items.description: Implantable identification chip verified by a reader; used with credentials and holocreds.

sources.quote: The device hissed softly as it pressed against Skree's wrist — click. Done... his tester flashed green.

items.name: Transport chamber
items.description: Chamber used to hold an unconscious subject for transfer.

sources.quote: Skree lay peacefully in the transport chamber, unconscious but breathing softly.

items.name: Supersonic flier
items.description: Sleek, silver-colored transport used for long-range travel.

sources.quote: A supersonic flier… looked more like a bird of prey than a bulky commuter vessel.

items.name: Study pod
items.description: Enclosed pod Shelly uses to take proctored certifications.

sources.quote: She stepped into the study pod… the door hissed shut. Cool darkness wrapped around her.

technologies.name: Stella AI
technologies.description: Central AI that governs Metrofederacy citizens individually and without bias.

sources.quote: For those hundred years, the Metrofederacy has thrived... because Stella governs each of them individually, fairly, and without bias.

technologies.name: SAIR
technologies.description: The Stella Aggregated Identity Ranking. Your SAIR tracks thousands of discrete data elements on you, which aggregate up to form your composite score. Your SAIR composite score will open doors to different career paths, upgrade your compensation levels, unlock new housing opportunities, and allow you to pursue different and interesting occupations and hobbies that might not have been available.

sources.quote: The public won't wait for answers once SAIR rankings fail and the illusion of stability vanishes.
Her concert pianist specification was still active in her SAIR.
She opened the certification tab on her SAIR… Medical Doctorate exam module.

name: SAIR
description: System hosting certification tabs and exam modules for professional tracks.

technologies.name: localcast
technologies.description: Short-range data transfer to neural interfaces.

sources.quote: He... localcasting a report into Chairman Adlawan's neural interface.

technologies.name: neural interface
technologies.description: User interface accessed via sensors (e.g., palette patches) for receiving localcast content.

sources.quote: He swiped his tongue along the sensor patches... localcasting a report into... neural interface.

technologies.name: tri-D feed
technologies.description: Immersive video assembled from multiple drone feeds.

sources.quote: stitched from drone feeds, tagged less than twenty-four hours ago. The tri-D feed started...

technologies.name: drone feeds
technologies.description: Captured video and telemetry sources used to assemble tri-D footage.

sources.quote: stitched from drone feeds, tagged less than twenty-four hours ago.

technologies.name: holographic display
technologies.description: Display used by Montague to show a real-time death-rate countdown.

sources.quote: Chairman Montague has a holographic display showing death rate — in it, you can watch the world's population ticking down...

technologies.name: suborbital aircraft
technologies.description: High-speed aircraft used for regional/continental travel.

sources.quote: His suborbital sat on the tarmac, refueling. Engines were still warm.

technologies.name: ethanol fuel cells
technologies.description: Fuel cell power units using ethanol for caravan trucks.

sources.quote: They used ethanol fuel cells to power the trucks.

technologies.name: scissor-lift weapons mount
technologies.description: Rusty scissor-lift platforms mounted on trucks to elevate machine guns.

sources.quote: Four machine guns, atop rusty scissor-lifts, rose... from the backs of four heavy trucks.

technologies.name: PID
technologies.description: Personal Interface Device — the main UI for interact with Stella.

sources.quote: Her PID — the hoodie and tracksuit she wore shimmered, shifting into a sleeveless black dress...
Alejandro accessed his PID, calculated coordinates, and dropped them into the flight computer.
Skree's optics... information was just now appearing on her PID.

technologies.notes: normalized_from:tech_type:UI Homescreen to the Stella AI and the digital world. normalized_from:tech_type:UI Interface to Stella normalized_from:resolved_conflict:tech_type normalized_from:resolved_conflict:description

technologies.name: StellaNet
technologies.description: A network where records can be searched and erased; supports backtraces.

sources.quote: Someone crawled StellaNet and erased Fay... Even Stella's backtraces had nothing.

technologies.name: Remote device management system
technologies.description: System used to track device locations and remotely brick terminals.

sources.quote: The device is here,” Simon said... showing a screen with numbers and a little dot...
“Anyway, we should just remote brick it,” Simon said.

technologies.name: tri-D full immersion feed
technologies.description: A full-immersion tri-D simulation feed used to guide an operative.

sources.quote: the vibrant full-immersion tri-D simulation in which Skree was guiding Li Mei

technologies.name: corpus callosum interface
technologies.description: An interface component associated with the neuroject implant.

sources.quote: The corpus callosum interface was only one part of the neuroject implant which

technologies.name: neuroject implant
technologies.description: An implant capable of receiving real-time directive communications via a corpus callosum interface.

sources.quote: the neuroject implant which could receive real-time directive communications

technologies.name: Dermoweave skin
technologies.description: A synthetic skin referred to as Dermoweave, associated with mercenaries.

sources.quote: She imagined her body sliding against Dermoweave skin and the man, the mercenary... thrusting toward her like

technologies.name: Cybernetic computer core (abdominal)
technologies.description: Implanted compute core replacing uterus, fallopian tubes, and ovaries.
capabilities: ≈10^21 calculations/sec extreme mode with external power/cooling
≈10^21 calculations/sec in extreme mode with external power and cooling

sources.quote: We removed her uterus, fallopian tubes, and ovaries. That is where we installed the computer core.
Ten to the 12th calculations per second at idle... she can jump it up to ten to the 21st in extreme calculation mode.
We removed her uterus, fallopian tubes, and ovaries. That is where we installed the computer core.

technologies.name: Solid-state polymer batteries
technologies.description: Embedded batteries supporting the cybernetic core.
capabilities: onboard power storage for implanted systems

sources.quote: Then, there's the solid-state polymer batteries, the power couplers, insulation, and cooling systems...
Then, there's the solid-state polymer batteries, the power couplers, insulation, and cooling systems...

description: Embedded batteries supporting implanted systems.

technologies.name: Full-immersion simulation
technologies.description: Observer-only simulation stream enabling sensory perspective sharing.

sources.quote: We cannot interact with the world in any way. We can only observe.

technologies.name: Embedded ID chip
technologies.description: Subdermal identification/payment chip used via wrist gesture.

sources.quote: She ordered a Digital Distortion Hazy IPA and paid with a swipe of her wrist and the embedded ID chip.
paid with a swipe of her wrist and the embedded ID chip.

technologies.name: InteractDB utility
technologies.description: Open-source utility that overlays names and details over people in view.

sources.quote: courtesy of the open-source InteractDB utility... names, handles, and information started appearing over people's heads
open-source InteractDB utility... names, handles, and information started appearing

technologies.name: CF-67 cryptography
technologies.description: Encryption scheme referenced in an intercepted message.

sources.quote: we've just intercepted a CF-67 encrypted message from Terracotta Army.
intercepted a CF-67 encrypted message from Terracotta Army.

technologies.name: Decryption toolkit
technologies.description: Tool suite Skree uses to analyze and decrypt encrypted data.

sources.quote: She brought up her decryp toolkit, throwing the attachment into the rightmost pane.

description: Tool suite used to analyze and decrypt encrypted data.

technologies.name: Multidimensional, holographic encryption
technologies.description: An encryption paradigm Skree decrypts rapidly.

sources.quote: "Multidimensional, holographic encryption," Fay said coolly.
'Multidimensional, holographic encryption,' Fay said coolly.

description: Encryption paradigm Skree can crack rapidly.

technologies.name: Holographic non-linear array algorithm
technologies.description: Algorithm used to secure the holocred network.

sources.quote: similar to the holographic non-linear array algorithm used to secure the holocred network.

technologies.name: Holocred network
technologies.description: Network secured by a holographic non-linear array algorithm.

sources.quote: used to secure the holocred network.

technologies.name: Magnetic levitation system
technologies.description: Maglev system powering podlev transport.

sources.quote: The magnetic levitation system hummed beneath her feet.

technologies.name: Dermoweave
technologies.description: Armored weave worn by Lesha; flexible like skin and strong enough to stop blades and small-arms fire. Hex tiles are replaceable.

sources.quote: Her armored Dermoweave flexed and moved like skin, yet it was strong enough to stop blades and even small-arms fire... each of the little hex tiles could be popped out and repla...
Her armored Dermoweave flexed and moved like skin, yet it was strong enough to stop blades and even small-arms fire...

technologies.name: Sykotiq
technologies.description: A drug (combat stimulant) that 'plagues the wildlands'; referenced as being made in a dirty bathtub.

sources.quote: Lesha emerged from her Sykotiq-induced stupor.
Withdrawals are kicking in...
What treatment was there for Sykotiq addiction?

technologies.name: Macrobus
technologies.description: Global network similar to the internet, except speeds and latency make it operate more like a computer BUS than a network of computers.

sources.quote: they are all online, on the Macrobus. I'm looking at them now on my optical implants.
A couple of days ago, it had crashed all over Fox River.

technologies.name: Optical implants
technologies.description: Visual implants used to view online manuals.

sources.quote: I'm looking at them now on my optical implants.

technologies.name: Corneal implants
technologies.description: Augmentations suggested for Quincy to reduce disadvantages.

sources.quote: look into at least getting corneals...

technologies.name: Aural implants
technologies.description: Hearing-related implants suggested for Quincy.

sources.quote: aural implants

technologies.name: Lip mic
technologies.description: Communication interface suggested for Quincy.

sources.quote: lip mic, aural implants, and a lingual interface.

technologies.name: Lingual interface
technologies.description: User input interface actuated with the tongue for controlling systems or vision modes.

sources.quote: and a lingual interface.
He flicked his tongue against his lingual interface...
With a subtle flick of her lingual interface, Fay adjusted her own vision...

technologies.name: SCALPEL scripts
technologies.description: Intrusion software: Source Concealing Adaptive Logic Polymorphic Entry/Exploit Link.

sources.quote: SCALPEL scripts.
Source Concealing Adaptive Logic Polymorphic Entry/Exploit Link.

technologies.name: AEGIS
technologies.description: Countermeasure to SCALPEL scripts; security software that detects and prevents hackers from intruding.

sources.quote: It's the counterpart to SCALPEL scripts. It's security software.
Skree's control matrices were defended by some of the world's most advanced AEGIS...

technologies.name: Multifunc apartment fabricator
technologies.description: In-apartment system that provides on-demand buildouts such as kitchen, toilet, shower, and beverages.

sources.quote: she called up the multifunc interface and ordered a kitchen.
She ordered a toilet from the multifunc
She stood from the chair... She had already called for a shower.

technologies.name: Holocreds
technologies.description: Currency used outside the Metrofederacy.

sources.quote: The Divine Order... was accepting vast sums of holocreds... The Metrofederacy was, in essence, funding its own potential destruction.
The Divine Order... was accepting vast sums of holocreds.
“We took millions of Metrofederacy holos.”

technologies.name: Stella
technologies.description: Described in text as a machine opposed by Jessop; widely condemned by him.

sources.quote: 'Stella, a false god... a machine whose sole purpose was to murder God.'
Stella, a false god... a machine whose sole purpose was to murder God.

description: AI system condemned by Jessop in earlier scenes.

technologies.name: Nav computer
technologies.description: In-vehicle navigation computer preprogrammed with destination.

sources.quote: He switched on the nav computer. The Calum-Tam Holdfast was already programmed in.

technologies.name: Activation chip
technologies.description: An activation chip associated with Demmy's access to a TEG-6.

sources.quote: I wonder if Master McTanner would mind me borrowing that TEG-6. I've still got the activation chip.

technologies.name: Localnet
technologies.description: Local network used to load messages delivered by runners during the blackout.

sources.quote: Jeb had runners... downloading messages, and then loading them onto the localnet by hand.

technologies.name: Diesel–fertilizer explosive charges
technologies.description: Remotely triggered charges mixing diesel fuel and fertilizer in crates beneath Fox River, detonated by igniters.

sources.quote: Allowing hundreds of gallons of diesel fuel to flow into dozens of one-ton crates of fertilizer... then the igniters.

technologies.name: Armored skin
technologies.description: Subdermal/dermal armor augment enabling Lesha to shrug off small-arms fire.

sources.quote: Bullets landed, but kept walking, paying little heed to the projectiles that deflected off of her armored skin.

technologies.name: Fly-eye drone
technologies.description: Miniature drones with millimeter cameras.

sources.quote: The only sound was the high-pitched whine of the fly-eyes detaching... millimeter cameras transmitting a close-up of his trembling hand.
Werner's fly-eyes had detached and were hovering in the air, watching her.

technologies.name: Forensic drones
technologies.description: Drones used to perform grid sweeps aimed at crime scene coverage.

sources.quote: I have some forensic drones. We can do a grid sweep. Fully automated — we're after crime scene coverage, not visual impact.

technologies.name: Holotank
technologies.description: Immersive display target for stitched multi-drone tri-D feeds.

sources.quote: I'm stitching thirty different drone feeds... we'll have full immersion for the holotank.

technologies.name: Tri-D
technologies.description: Immersive multi-axis audiovisual capture used for reporting and analysis. Includes omnidirectional sight, sound, haptics, and even smell.

sources.quote: Getting six-axis tri-D, sound, and... stench.
"You should see it in full immersion tri-D," Werner mumbled.

description: Immersive multi-axis audiovisual capture used for reporting and analysis.

technologies.name: Silver eye optical implants
technologies.description: Optical processors with lens-like shutters; branded ring visible.

sources.quote: Shutters snapped open on his silver eyes, revealing the dark pools of the optical sensors beneath. Nikon rotated around the lens-like edges.

technologies.name: Dermoweave armor
technologies.description: Armor with hexagonal skin pattern worn by mercenaries.

sources.quote: Two massive figures, their skin covered in the hexagonal patterns of Dermoweave armor...

technologies.name: Incubation tank
technologies.description: Tank used for incubation and decanting of a subject.

sources.quote: Technicians meticulously cleaned the recently decanted incubation tank.

technologies.name: CF-67 Encryption
technologies.description: Metrofederacy Tier-1 encryption standard using QRNG-based rotating keys; tied to Holocred security.

sources.quote: CF-67… employs a synchronized quantum random number generator as a dynamically rotating seed… decryption is infeasible without synchronized hardware.

technologies.name: Thermal drone
technologies.description: Drone platform reprogrammable for low-altitude IR scans.

sources.quote: Can you reprogram a thermal drone and do a low-altitude IR scan around the edges?

technologies.name: EVAT — Explosive Vector Analysis Toolkit
technologies.description: Forensic modeling suite used to analyze blast vectors, yields, and crater dynamics.

sources.quote: She tongue-tapped her PID and loaded her forensic analysis suite. EVAT — Explosive Vector Analysis Toolkit.

locations.name: Thórsmörk Palace
locations.description: Industry Party headquarters with sapphire-glass windows; scene set with aurora over Icelandic mountain ranges.

sources.quote: Thórsmörk Palace, Industry Party Headquarters — 27 August, 2181

locations.name: Teragen HQ
locations.description: Headquarters of Teragen, referenced for potential travel.

sources.quote: Board a suborbital to Teragen HQ, pretend this wasn't his problem.

locations.name: Wildlands
locations.description: Regions outside the Metrofederacy, associated with instability and violence.

sources.quote: four billion still outside. And add to that the four billion dead since Stella went live.
The TEG-6 hummed along the desolate terrain… in the vast, unforgiving wildlands.

locations.name: Icelandic Mountain ranges
locations.description: Mountain ranges visible from Thórsmörk Palace.

sources.quote: the aurora borealis shimmered over Icelandic Mountain ranges.

locations.name: South-Central Oklahoma
locations.description: Area where the Three Shovels Caravan set up to trade water.

sources.quote: what was once South-Central Oklahoma

locations.name: Broken Bow Free City
locations.description: Free city mentioned as ~300 km away; borders closed except legitimate traders or those with enough holos to buy residency. Libertarian city.

sources.quote: 'Broken Bow's about three hundred kilometers away,' Davian said.
It's a free city... borders are closed except for legitimate traders or those with enough holos to buy residency.
Broken Bow. The last safe place that was close enough for Chase to get the help he needed.
The TEG-6 accelerated, making its way to Broken Bow Free City.

locations.name: Fox River
locations.description: Polity/place with a Chancellor and a council; half the government is theocratic.

sources.quote: Half of our government is theocratic... presenting anything to my mom or the council.
The device is here,” Simon said... showing a screen with numbers and a little dot...
A map of Fox River appeared, a dot appearing on the screen.
Says here she's underneath Fox River. She's even deeper than the subterranean levels.
Now, the Fox River legal system was facing a deluge. Two hours ago, the council had convened.
A searing white flash... then the boom came... a monstrous fireball erupted from the city's heart.
Fox River is... gone... there's just nothing left but wreckage and debris... a big, smoking hole.
Fox River, his home, was gone. Reduced to ashes.
Fox River, once a vibrant wildland city, now a festering wound on the earth.
Below, the remnants of Fox River sprawled… not a city, not anymore. Just a carcass.

description: City with subterranean levels; location tracking showed a target beneath mapped levels.
City whose council and legal system act in the scenes.
City with governing council and legal system referenced earlier.
City that suffered a catastrophic explosion on 3 December, 2186.
City described as gone after a catastrophic event.
Described as a wildland city devastated in the scene.
Wildlands city devastated by a buried, high-yield explosion.

locations.name: Calum-Tam Holdfast
locations.description: Holdfast associated with Lenya and her father; Sean Calum has been dead two years.

sources.quote: Sean Calum's been dead two years... Now — it's just Father and I.
This is a slaver holdfast... They have dogs, vehicles, guns, and UAV drones. Oh, and they also have traps.
do I think Calum-Tam employs AEGIS?
This is a slaver holdfast... They have dogs, vehicles, guns, and UAV drones.
There's a place, about a day and a half away by vehicle... The Calum-Tam Holdfast. It seems they're on rather good terms with Ransom Canyon.
They're slavers, if I recall. A shitty little place.
There's a place, about a day and a half away by vehicle... The Calum-Tam Holdfast.
Ravagers. Five hundred, maybe more. Saw them approach. This place is about to become a bloodbath.
From somewhere behind them... a heavy machine gun's rhythmic tac-tac-tac... another joined... the holdfast.
Calum-Tam Holdfast was under attack? By Jessop's ravagers?

description: Holdfast where Quincy, Chase, and Lesha are kept; employs dogs, vehicles, guns, UAV drones, and traps to prevent escape.
Holdfast about a day and a half away by vehicle; on good terms with Ransom Canyon; described in dialogue as engaging in slavery.
Holdfast about a day and a half away by vehicle; on good terms with Ransom Canyon; site of Quincy and Chase's captivity.
Holdfast with a perimeter wall, warehouse, and adjacent hut; site of a ravager attack.

locations.name: Fox River Defense Center
locations.description: A Defense Center with deep, old rooms and remote terminals where operators work.

sources.quote: In one of the deepest, oldest rooms of Fox River’s Defense Center, Simon sat across from Elmer at a

locations.name: Cryodyne hacker hangout
locations.description: Bar/hangout where hackers and Cryodyne personnel socialize.

sources.quote: Tonight, she was headed to the Cryodyne hacker hangout...
headed to the Cryodyne hacker hangout...

locations.name: Autopacker warehouse
locations.description: Warehouse containing the malfunctioning autopacker; includes nearby hydroponics stations and latrine with hose and running water.

sources.quote: the whole apartment began to shake.
Latrine's over there... by the hydroponics stations.

locations.name: Fox River lower levels
locations.description: Areas beneath Fox River referenced as off-limits and the location marker for Evelyn.

sources.quote: the location marker deep beneath Fox River
We've been barred from those lower levels for years.
At the end of the hall, a massive metal door barred his path.

description: Areas beneath Fox River referenced as off-limits and location of a secured metal door and offices.

locations.name: Fox River chapel
locations.description: Chapel area with a screened side passage leading toward an 'Authorized Personnel Only' doorway and stairwell.

sources.quote: He passed by other offices and meeting rooms, as well as a tiny chapel... a wooden panel that screened visibility to the right-hand side.
He walked back to the chapel, then slipped behind the screen... A sign declared: AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL ONLY.
a tiny chapel... a wooden panel that screened visibility to the right-hand side.

locations.name: Ransom Canyon
locations.description: Violent, near-lawless city of ravagers.

sources.quote: these fuckers are also sending messages to Ransom Canyon... a message here that has this Bivualier, Dinh Tam, and some guy name Makko from Ransom Canyon.
sending messages to Ransom Canyon... a message here that has this... Makko from Ransom Canyon.
Jessop funneled holocreds to Ransom Canyon, funding a nascent military arm for his church.
Fox River and Ransom Canyon are hardly on friendly terms. I'd say we're teetering on the brink of open hostility.
Jessop funneled holocreds to Ransom Canyon, funding a nascent military arm.
Ransom Canyon's close, but ravagers aren't talkative...

locations.name: downbelow
locations.description: Tunnels beneath Fox River used as evidence sources.

sources.quote: The sheer volume of evidence collected from the tunnels beneath Fox River, now dubbed the 'downbelow,' was staggering.
Evidence collected from the tunnels beneath Fox River, now dubbed the 'downbelow'.

locations.name: Calum-Tam holding pens
locations.description: Upper level connected by steps to the cells below.

sources.quote: The steps connecting the top floor of the holding pens to the cells below.

locations.name: Calum-Tam cells
locations.description: Cells where Quincy and Chase were held.

sources.quote: Quincy was numb, sitting on the dirty floor of the cell they had originally inhabited.

locations.name: Calum-Tam warehouse
locations.description: Large warehouse structure in Calum-Tam.

sources.quote: They would be going past the warehouse, its massive structure looming to their right.

locations.name: Calum-Tam hut (by warehouse)
locations.description: Small hut beside the warehouse where stimulant vials were stored.

sources.quote: Lenya... pointing at the little hut beside the warehouse.

locations.name: Broken Bow Free City
locations.description: Identified as a free city with mid-level tech located in what was once South-Central Oklahoma.

sources.quote: Leaves Broken Bow. It's a free city with mid-level tech.
A driver's standing by to curry her to Broken Bow Free City...
The other end? South-Central Oklahoma. A place called Broken Bow Free City.
Destination: Fox River/Broken Bow Free City… Classified Operation – Forensic Division.

locations.name: Tahua Outpost
locations.description: Facility context implied by chapter handle.

sources.quote: File handle includes 'Tahua Outpost Special Projects Three'.

locations.name: Incubation Room
locations.description: Room where the incubation tank was cleaned and the subject prepared.

sources.quote: Li Mei entered the incubation room...

locations.name: Utility Chiller 13
locations.description: Infrastructure node used as a jump vector within the facility.

sources.quote: Fay accessed her jump node through Utility Chiller 13 — still the dumbest goddamn vector in the whole facility...

locations.name: Western Bolivia abandoned town
locations.description: Tiny abandoned town on the edge of a large salt flat; endpoint of CF-67 stream.

sources.quote: One endpoint is in an abandoned town in Western Bolivia on the edge of a huge salt flat.

organizations.name: Industry Party
organizations.description: Political party; headquarters at Thórsmörk Palace.

sources.quote: Thórsmörk Palace, Industry Party Headquarters

organizations.name: Humanity Party
organizations.description: Political party led by Chairman Giles Montague pushing to expand Stella's coverage; has the votes to force an update.

sources.quote: The Humanity Party has been waiting fifty years for this moment. They have the votes.

organizations.name: Balance Party
organizations.description: Political party referenced regarding rules updates.

sources.quote: What about the Balance Party? Aren't they supposed to prevent rules updates that destabilize Stella?

organizations.name: Metrofederacy
organizations.description: AI-Government managed by the Stella world AI; current population cited at two billion citizens.

sources.quote: For those hundred years, the Metrofederacy has thrived... because Stella governs each of them...
In the Metro... you would have had drones overhead looking for survivors... There would have been power. All the power you could need.
There would have been entrance tests at caravan entrances... the ones who passed would be treated well within its walls.
they're taking money from the Metrofederacy!
The Forensic Investigator IV certification hung over her... The highest clearance Stella granted to any civilian forensic agent.
The dream she'd nurtured... Metrofederacy membership — was finally within reach.

organizations.name: Teragen
organizations.description: Company led by Romuald Anwar; concerned with Stella capacity and models.

sources.quote: You're Teragen's CEO — you don't do easy.

organizations.name: Three Shovels Caravan
organizations.description: Caravan community; Quincy's lifelong home; trades water and supplies; uses mounted guns for security.

sources.quote: The Three Shovels Caravan, her lifelong home... was fleeing without her.
They parked the caravan on a hill... selling water; Stan sat with the chip reader...
Four machine guns, atop rusty scissor-lifts, rose like skeletal claws from the backs of four heavy trucks.

organizations.name: Fox River
organizations.description: Polity/place with a Chancellor and a council; half the government is theocratic, the other secular.

sources.quote: You know I'm loyal to Fox River and to my mother, Chancellor Margdelain... Half of our government is theocratic.

organizations.name: Calum-Tam Holdfast
organizations.description: Holdfast led by Dinh Tam and his daughter Lenya Tam where Quincy and Chase were held captive.

sources.quote: Do you really think someday our holdfast and Fox River might work together?

organizations.name: Cryodyne
organizations.description: Mostly fictitious company referenced within the VR scenario associated with Skree.

sources.quote: Leonard, 'Palisade', Network security, Cryodyne...
Network security, Cryodyne...
the scripted attack against Cryodyne — the mostly fictitious company her creation worked for — would begin right here in VR
One of the mercenaries, clad in a Cryodyne uniform, locked eyes with Skree.

organizations.name: Terracotta Army
organizations.description: Entity associated with a CF-67 encrypted message.

sources.quote: we've just intercepted a CF-67 encrypted message from Terracotta Army.
intercepted a CF-67 encrypted message from Terracotta Army.

organizations.name: holdfast
organizations.description: Wildland community run by a family or group of families, scratching out a living by growing crops and raising livestock and trading for essentials through trade caravans.

sources.quote: On the way, they would stop by a few holdfasts to trade and take orders.
preserving the vegetables we took in trade at the last holdfast.
Maybe some have enough to buy a bunk at some nearby holdfast … they'll work their asses off, but at least they'll get food and protection.

organizations.name: Calum-Tam Holdfast (organization)
organizations.description: Administrative/owner entity operating the Calum-Tam Holdfast.

sources.quote: do I think Calum-Tam employs AEGIS?

organizations.name: Stella
organizations.description: World-spanning AI that governs and operates the Metrofederacy.

sources.quote: She knew what Stella would see — and what it wouldn't.
The highest clearance Stella granted to any civilian forensic agent.
No case update. Nothing flagged from Stella.
Once we submit this story, we'll update our Stella career paths and register the case.
Stella's recommending a forensic investigator to formalize the job spec.
Stella's voice whispered orientation instructions… The test began.
Two hours ago, the council had convened... her proposal to formally explore Metrofederacy membership passed almost unanimously.
Two hours ago, the council had convened... proposal to explore Metrofederacy membership passed.

organizations.name: TRiGgers
organizations.description: Special-operations unit associated with Fox River.

sources.quote: I'm training with the TRiGgers, with their spec-ops guys.
"I'm training with the TRiGgers, with their spec-ops guys," he said.

organizations.name: StellaNet
organizations.description: One of the news platforms via which Metrofederacy news is prepared and broadcast.

sources.quote: Let's wrap it up... We'll find a spot to do the report for StellaNet,
Splicing together video and stills for the broadcast took time.
StellaNet reporter and cameraperson… she didn’t even need their headshots.
A StellaNet alert flashed in her PID — an explosion in some Wildlander city.

factions.name: Ravagers
factions.description: Wild, lawless outlaws who roam the Wildlands stealing, burning, looting, and killing.

sources.quote: This was a ravager camp. The whole nest of wild homicidal maniacs must have chased after the caravan.
They showed up with machine guns and explosives. They threw hooks and cables over holdfast walls and pulled them down.
The ravager six-seater was slathered with crude armor... three tight bullet holes... the control nexus was shredded.
“We’re involved with the ravagers?!” Evelyn exclaimed.
wildlanders are being murdered by ravagers that are suddenly organized.
Ravagers. Five hundred, maybe more. Saw them approach.
"Pretty sure your guards are busy with the ravager attack," Demmy said.
Calum-Tam Holdfast was under attack? By Jessop's ravagers?
Ransom Canyon's close, but ravagers aren't talkative... and tend to be on the murdery side

factions.name: skervs
factions.description: Desperate people queueing for water at the caravan’s trading site.

sources.quote: Groups of skervs stirred like leaves around the caravan.

factions.name: Order
factions.description: A group referred to as the Order that Evelyn is associated with.

sources.quote: She had tried to show Demmy he could trust the Order, that we were trying to protect people.

factions.name: The Order
factions.description: Religious order implicated in working with ravagers per messages shown to Demmy.

sources.quote: The Order is working with the ravagers.
each handle bearing the familiar emblem of the Order

description: Religious order implicated in working with ravagers per messages shown to Demmy; symbols appear on letter opener handles.

factions.name: Fox River Tactical Response Group
factions.description: Armed response force mobilized at the Chancellor's direction.

sources.quote: I'll alert the TRG immediately!
a message relayed through her aural implant confirmed that McTanner's forces were already moving...
Around them, TRG fighters swarmed, subduing the remaining clerics.

description: Armed response force mobilized at the Chancellor's direction; subdues clerics underground.

factions.name: Divine Order of the Sanctifying Flame
factions.description: Religious order inside Fox River led by Brother Jessop (now destroyed).

sources.quote: Jessop's Divine Order of the Sanctifying Flame was accepting vast sums of holocreds... The Metrofederacy was... funding its own potential destruction.
Jessop's Divine Order of the Sanctifying Flame was accepting vast sums of holocreds.
Under attack? By Jessop's ravagers?

factions.name: Blacklight Syndicate
factions.description: Elite private paramilitary organization with limitless resource and talent. Only the most wealthy (Metrofederacy) can afford their services.

sources.quote: "Blacklight Syndicate?!" Lesha gasped... "Tell me you're lying, asshole."
